poem:
"The Fleeting Shadow"

The sun, eclipsed,
waits for no man -
yet man waits for it.
In the palette of the sky,
a cloud dallies or scurries,
1984 or 2044.
Patient watchers look to the heavens,
longing for the next shadow play 
of celestial wheeling.
Cherish, then - 
the spectacle now, 
for it, like all things,
is merely a fleeting shadow.
